intro: Pachystoma wightii, commonly known as the rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often growing in crevices and on rock faces. Due to its resilience and low water requirements, it is well adapted to harsh, dry environments.
